discussion.p: In the old way of looking at the world, forward iterators need to return real references. Since dereferencing iota_view's iterators returns by value, it cannot be a C++17 forward iterator. (It can, however, be a C++20 forward_iterator.) However, iota_view's iterator has an iterator_category that (sometimes) falsely claims that it is forward or better (depending on the properties of the weakly_incrementable type it wraps).
Status to Tentatively Ready and priority to 0 after eight positive votes on the reflector.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

li.p: (1.1) — If W models advanceable, then iterator_conceptategory is random_access_iterator_tag.
(1.2) — Otherwise, if W models decrementable, then iterator_conceptategory is bidirectional_iterator_tag.
(1.3) — Otherwise, if W models incrementable, then iterator_conceptategory is forward_iterator_tag.
